content:
Got two subproofs as part of a proof which both verify individually, but I get a timeout when I run both. The proofs in question are really hard to untangle without adding a ton of arguments to everything.

Other forums online point to VSCode settings which don't seem to exist. Does anyone know how to increase the timeout?
Could you provide the exact timeout error you are experiencing?
It could be interesting to have the code as well, to provide faster and more accurate answer

To be honest, the code was far to big to post here and I couldn't find a great MWE. But for others looking at this topic, the issue was having a hypothesis accidentally defined with 'let' rather than 'have'. Still didn't find a way to increase timeout though.
Alexander Gillon has marked this topic as resolved.
We don't know what's timing out until you post the error. Then we'll be able to tell you how to stop that thing from timing out.
In fact the errors often explain how to increase the relevant timeout
